text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The Cypriot lobby in Athens was responsible for the downfall of Greek deputy foreign minister Christos Rozakis.
- Employers union OEV is expecting President Clerides' proposals on payment of cost of living allowances soon.
- Archbishop Makarios rejected union with Greece in 1966, British Foreign Office documents show.
- Port authorities move to stamp out Limassol port bribes.
- Prison is to boost security after recent spate of unrest.
- Russia repeats calls for urgent action on Cyprus.
- Deputy foreign minister of Greece resigns - officially - for health reasons. He was against the defence pact Cyprus has with Greece.
- Russia calls for joint action of permanent U.N. Security Council members on Cyprus.
- The government is due to sign a contract today to purchase Russian surface-to-air S300 missiles.
- Workers in semi-government organisations threaten strike.
- Criminal inquiry starts over kickbacks allegations in ports authority.
